Overview
This is an exciting opportunity to join our client's Innovation and Strategy team at the ground level ! You will be part of our innovation hub located in downtown Toronto where your desire for impact will only be matched by your innate ability to collaborate with other like-minded individuals to come up with creative solutions to our client's retail data science problems.

Job Description
á Maintaining, streamlining and hardening existing data pipelines, from ingestion, through ETL and batch processing in order to reliably process billions of records per day.
á Build data support for our personalization and experimentation efforts, solving problems from statistical test automation to building real-time M/L applications.
á Working with Analytics and Product Management to ensure optimal data design and efficiency.
á Assisting Data Analysts and Data Scientists with pipeline and model deployment
á Use an analytical, data-driven approach to drive a deep understanding of our fast changing business.
á Building data models to deliver insightful analytics while ensuring the highest standard in data integrity.

Job Requirements
á Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, Finance or related quantitative field, or equivalent practical experience.
á Experience and proficiency with SQL and SQL-like languages
á More than 3 years of software engineering experience, especially working on back-end data infrastructure.
á Proficiency with at least one of the following languages: Java, Python, Scala.
á Proficiency with Spark and/or similar tools in Hadoop/YARN environment and comfortable with Linux operating system.
á Ability to creatively solve problems in a fast paced, rapidly changing environment
á Ability to navigate ambiguity, drive solutions forward and bring stakeholders along.
á Strong problem solving, analytical skills and capability of managing multiple projects and reporting simultaneously across different stakeholders.
á Strong structured thinking and the ability to easily break down complex ambiguous problems and propose impactful data modeling designs.

At EY, youÕll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And weÕre counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.

EY is a global leader in Assurance, Tax, Transaction and Consulting Services. The insights and quality services we deliver help build trust and confidence in the capital markets and in economies the world over. We develop outstanding leaders who build high performing teams to deliver on our promises to all of our stakeholders. In so doing, we play a critical role in building a better working world for our people, for our clients and for our communities.

Our Assurance group is one of the most trusted, respected and influential organizations in the industry. As part of our team, you will provide peace of mind to clients by using your skills and experience to give companies, investors and regulators confidence in the validity of financial statements and business-critical information or processes. Groups (or, as we call them, sub-service lines) within Assurance include External Audit, Climate Change and Sustainability Services, Financial Accounting Advisory Services and Fraud Investigation & Dispute Services.

Job Responsibilities

Work closely with the manager and internal account teams to understand the scope and timelines for Market Mix Modeling (MMM) projects
Help with data collection and processing
Write reproducible SQL scripts for data processing and manipulation
Become a subject matter expert on the assigned clients. At Mediabrands, we expect all our modelers to have a solid understanding of the clientsÕ business and the media landscape
Leverage MediabrandsÕ proprietary tools for modeling and media optimizations
Assist the team with preparing presentations for insights communication to the client
Work with the manager to identify scope for process improvements and automation

Our Data Scientists come from diverse backgrounds: computer science, business, economics, and physics to name a few! We are solving diverse problems in the business and appreciate diverse perspectives. Our product direction is data driven and weÕre all working toward one common goal: make commerce better for everyone.

The Data Science & Engineering team acts as the impact multiplier for ShopifyÕs product teams, putting over 11 petabytes of retail data to work to make our merchants more successful. YouÕll make an impact on delivering merchandising insights, optimizing shipping and processing rates, reducing credit card fraud, ad campaign recommendations, and more!

As someone who thrives in a rapidly changing environment, you will develop a deep understanding of our data, tools, and processes by measuring key metrics, promoting new analytical techniques and questioning assumptions. You love to tell the story behind the numbers, and will clean, model, and analyze a wide variety of data sources.
What will you do?
Develop data science analytic approaches such as machine learning, deep learning, and natural language programming
Assist with the development of compelling and effective data visualizations
Develop interactive dashboards, reports and data visualizations allowing the end-user to explore data and discover insights independently
Lead the design, development and implementation of prototypes and proof of concepts for data, analytic and predictive models, research products and analysis platforms
Apply Software Engineering and application development skills to build robust, scalable and cost -effective Data Science applications
Work directly with a wide array of audiences to structure analytical problems and approaches
Communicate complex results to a business audience not familiar with complex Data and Analytics solutions

The Data Science and Advanced Analytics (DSAA) team at Unity Health Toronto houses a team of Data Scientists devoted to applying data science to advance patient care and health system efficiency at Unity Health Toronto. DSAA is looking for a Data Scientist who will focus on machine learning applications in healthcare.

DSAA works closely with physicians and administrators at St. MichaelÕs Hospital and researchers at the University of Toronto in a team-based environment. The Data Scientist will use the Enterprise Data Warehouse at St. MichaelÕs Hospital as the primary data source to provide data-driven insights into key drivers of patient outcomes and hospital performance. The Enterprise Data Warehouse at St. MichaelÕs Hospital is one of the most comprehensive inpatient databases in Canada.

As part of the data science team, the successful candidate will support Sr. Data Scientists in all stages of DSAA analytic projects. Responsibilities will include importing, manipulating and cleaning raw data, exploring and creating data summaries including data visualization and tabular reports. Additionally, the candidate will contribute to building and validating predictive models using analytical techniques such as time series analysis, multivariable regression analysis, and neural networks. Other responsibilities will include contributing to manuscripts and ethics applications, ad hoc report generation and support of data management activities, which may involve database validation, data review, and quality control. Data Scientists at the DSAA have areas of specialization within machine learning, simulation modeling, and/or biostatistics. The possible areas of specialization for this Data Scientist position are time series models, forecasting, graphical methods, Bayesian methods, and/or ML/ModelOps.

The Data Scientist is responsible for modeling complex enterprise scenarios, discovering enterprise insights and identifying opportunities in the use of statistical, algorithmic, mining and visualization techniques. In addition to advanced analytic skills, this role is also proficient at integrating and preparing large, varied datasets, architecting specialized database and computing environments, and communicating results in a way that is customized to the target audience.

This is an exciting role for someone seeking a challenging and dynamic role in enterprise analytics and an amazing opportunity to collaborate within IBI Group globally towards Connected and Smarter environment and operations. Working in close collaboration with buildings, land planning, infrastructure design and planning, transportation, and geomatics departments across IBI Group, the Data Scientist demonstrates the capability to turn data into critical information and knowledge that can be used to make sound decisions. The successful candidate possesses a combination of keen business consulting skills and a strong background in advanced analytical, problem solving and machine learning capabilities to quickly develop and validate through models.

EDC is CanadaÕs export credit agency, offering information, knowledge, and innovative commercial solutions to help Canadian exporters and investors expand their international business. We take on risk so Canadian businesses can take on the world.

When you join our team, youÕll be helping Canadian companies bring their vision, passion, and innovation to the global marketplace. Your knowledge and expertise will support more than 13,000 Canadian companies and their customers in as many as 200 markets worldwide. YouÕll work shoulder-to-shoulder with the best and brightest in an inclusive, collaborative environment that fosters professional development and success. And youÕll know that youÕre making a difference every dayÑfor companies, for Canada and for the people you work with.

Year after year, EDC has been recognized as one of CanadaÕs Top 100, Top Family-Friendly, Best Diversity and Greenest Employer.

At Intact, our value of Respect is founded on seeing diversity as a strength, being inclusive and fostering collaboration. We value diversity and strive to create an inclusive, accessible workplace where all individuals feel valued, respected and heard.

If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please advise the Talent Acquisition partner who reaches out about the job opportunity and they will work with you to meet your needs.

As an employer and publicly traded financial services company, the best interests of our customers, employees and shareholders are important to us. We want Intact to be a great place to work! This means that internal and external candidates will be asked to consent to background checks so we can learn more about you. Please note that for positions with access to financial data or funds, your credit must be in good standing.

For internal candidates, you can apply for a posted position if you have been in your current position for at least 12 months and are performing at a satisfactory level. Please note we may have identified other internal candidates through our Employee Development Program, and that the selection process may also be opened to external applicants.

What's in it for you?

Our supportive leadership and dedicated staff share an inclusive work environment. Your perks will include, monthly team lunches, office-based massages, and invitations to special events.

We appreciate all applicants but will contact only those who have been selected for the next steps.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $16.00-$18.00 per hour

Sharno Group is a privately-owned independent principal investment group and single-family office focused on identifying strategic, value-add investment opportunities across a wide range of traditional and alternative asset classes and strategies. With a commitment to value creation, the firm seeks strategic partnerships and employs a long-term perspective in its approach to investment underwriting and selection. The firm maintains its accounting function internally and seeks to leverage its infrastructure to support various investment and merchant banking initiatives. See our website for more information at www.sharnogroup.com.

Key Responsibilities
Measure and report on the performance of the entire AMD Radeon graphics product line, plus relevant competitors, using industry standard benchmarks, 3D games, and other relevant tests.
Measure, analyze and track the performance changes that arise in each new Radeon display driver. Characterize performance changes in terms of which products are most strongly affected, which resolutions, which framebuffer sizes, and similar. Generate summary points to be presented in the driver release notes and other outlets.
Measure the performance, features and quality of upcoming graphics products, comparing them to existing and competitor products. Use games, synthetic benchmarks, diagnostic tests and utilities as appropriate. Analyze results and report strengths, weaknesses, opportunities and threats. Analyze new competitor products in a similar fashion.
Contribute to reviewers' guides that highlight the performance and features of upcoming graphics products. Depict performance data in charts and graphs, document how to test steps and other relevant materials.
Monitor and report on trends in review techniques (titles used, resolutions, image quality settings, etc.). Track release schedules for new games and benchmarks. Incorporate new titles into the test flow in a timely manner.
Analyze new test applications and games for system and graphics sensitivities. Prepare and present reports that highlight the performance of key Radeon and competitor graphics products in the new title.
Write scripts and related tools to build command lines and configuration files that automate performance testing. Generate code that launches test applications at various settings, traps error conditions and takes remedial actions, parses result files, installs helper apps, etc.
Prepare images of current Windows operating systems to be deployed across numerous test machines. Use Microsoft sysprep and DISM tools. Update the OS images as required to keep pace with service packs and other updates.
